result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED OF $1,300 TO BE APPLIED TO THIS BOND. 
Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not be at It's Time Bar & Grill. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

Court reporter Rowan Thompson.Defendant Brittany K Pearson in court.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Brittany K Pearson.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Rob Csencsics from DCPS is also present in court. In court today for a bail/bond hearing on cases 22CF915, 22CF1248, and 22CF1435, due to DCPS violations. State gives argument and request an increase in cash bail of $500.00 per case. Mr. Csencsics gives statement. Atty Ver Hoeve gives argument. Ms. Pearson gives statement. Court makes findings and the court orders as follows: 

22CF915- Increase cash bail by $500.00 for a total of $1,300.00. $800.00 previously posted cash bail is to be applied to this bail. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

22CF1248- Increase cash bail by $500.00 for a total of $750.00. $250.00 previously posted cash bail is to be applied to this bail. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

22CF1435-Increase cash bail by $500.00 for a total of $750.00. $250.00 previously posted cash bail is to be applied to this bail. All other bail conditions will remain the same.

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant Brittany K Pearson in court.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Brittany K Pearson.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Rob Csencsics from Pretrial services in court. In court for bail review due to pretrial services violations. Mr. Csencsics gives statement. State makes statement, does not recommend more cash bail. Atty Ver Hoeve makes statement, does not want an increase in bail. Court makes findings and will not modify the bail conditions. ALL BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
  Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued
Br 17

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and waiver of atty and ordered case bound over; defn stated she wants an attorney but not for this particular hearing; Ct advised defn that she needs to be proactive and have an attorney at the next hearing or it's possible the court may find she's forfeited  her right to counsel.
and returned.
